title: League now hell for solo players?

replies.body:
Solo player here. I haven't noticed any difference in my games. I'm sure there are premades, but unless I get 5 man ganked I usually won't take notice. I think people are just using it as an excuse for their losses. I continue to hold essentially the same win-rate, and I'm still steadily climbing.

I think people are just looking for something to blame. The only time I'm ever (a bit) frustrated is when I'm in a full premade team, which is extremely rare (stats support this, so don't say every game you play is a premade, because it's not). Honestly, if 4 man queue was disable, that one frustrating game after like 50 would probably go away. Other than that, I love the new champion select and people seem WAY less toxic now that they get the roles they want. I think Riot did a solid job with DQ, it just needs some improvements now.

When you start climbing in high plat, let me know how much fun it is facing Skillful premades.
In low elo, **good** premades are rare, even if they are it's easy to beat them.

To test season 6 BEFORE Plat, I ran my smurf. This is how easy the game is before Plat 
http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=1suckharder

From my personal in-depth rank, i've faced:
4 man - 18% 
3 man - 21%
Duos - Nearly every round, but that's reasonable.

While riot is claiming it is only 1%.....

Premades are rewarded for team play. Their personal skill is usually much lower than of a Solo Player.

Too be honest anything above duoing should just be disabled in Diamond+

In that elo, it increases queue times, and premades actually become solid.

Was gonna comment exactly this. Solo ranked was rough before, its rough now, don't think DQ made a real difference.

Besides, i like being able to add people i work well with and play with them for a couple games. If youre anything like me youve got at least a dozen friends you found in your elo and now you can bring more than one at a time if it so happens theyre all ranking. I dont even skype with them, its just helpful to bring people who wont get crushed.

Either this or the season changes, or a combination of both have made climbing a lot harder.
Last Season I gto to gold 5 way more easier than this season.

nah, im on a constant cycle of climbing to gold then declimbing back down to S3/S4. its a nightmare. im hardcore tilted from it tbh which makes my games even worse. its pretty obvious that regardless of skill level, a organized team with communication will ALWAYS beat a team of unorganized players with zero communication and who constantly trash talk each other.

i play exclusively as a solo player, and the amount of feed that happens is annoying. i dont give a fuck what people say about "its your fault for not 1v5 carrying" but the PROBLEM here is that line of logic no longer works this season with dynamic que. it is EXTREMELY hard/damn near impossible to carry as a solo player vs an organized team, especially when your own team refused to listen to the 1 guy not in a fucking skype call with them.

this is true. I am a diamond 4 player smurfing in plat 2 and i literally am struggling to even maintain the same rating. I just demoted to plat 5 because every game I often get camped at bot lane, thus preventing me from using my superior aggression skills (like harassing the enemy on cs/abusing spell cooldowns) and minion wave control. I've experienced games where the enemy team literally sat at bot lane to take the turret very early in the game, preventing me from accessing the minion wave and they just snowball objectives , specifically dragon stacks.  

Tell me, how is this fair to the solo queue player?  When coordinated teams have access to all the tools designed to benefit a group of players rather than a single player?  The enemy laner doesn't even have to do anything on their own.  Their team can literally win the lane for them and get them  the advantages they need to be strong.

While mostly true, your first statement is questionable. Last time I found myself having 3-4 division swings is when I belonged to the middle of this region, so you probably belong to s3-s2, and lucky/unlucky streaks can move you to s1/s4. According to op.gg you didn't reach gold previously, which means it may be not just a premade issue.
I am solo support/mid player, gold 1 high from last season, gold 3-2 average, started this season in s4, now I'm playing against g2-p5 being gold 4. Which means, even if I'm on my lucky streak, it should be practically possible to at least repeat my s5 result. While premades are infuriating, you share you deal of influence on your games too.
I completely agree with this. Adding you.
I only play with friends now, dq is garbage if you are a solo player
That's why I'm currently looking for more people to team with.

I've always been a solo player. 

I enjoy playing this game just as much as I've enjoyed it over the years. I'm not picky nor do I care much about wins/losses. 

At the end of the day this is just a game and life will go on I promise you. 

Have fun. This game will get you NO WHERE in life.

How is this any different from last year?

Last year there was SOME form of integrity. Each time i climbed it felt like i put in that effort by MYSELF and learned to work with other people doing the same....

Now you can queue up with 4 others, climb to a rank you could never reach solo and on the same ranked ladder play solo and ruin the game for others.

Also queued friends never see the solo players as good, even if they make a lot of good plays. so they wont listen to them when their pal bobby on skype talks like he knows infinitely more.

Basically rank means nothing this season.
Definitely more coordinated salt and retardation.

I have found that to play solo you need to take a different approach. make friends with the others in your games, and make mock teams to progress. this emphasises working as a team and makes being a toxic fuck much less capable. if anything, this is a good thing.
thats not playing solo. thats called giving up solo to premade.

So basically to climb the ladder solo, you have to give up on being solo and become a premade.

THEN WHATS THE FUCKING POINT OF ALLOWING US TO PLAY SOLO? All it does is add unnessicary frustration and ruins the integrity of ranked. If you thought the system was broken as all fuck before then this is such a downgrade it's laughable.
been saying since day one, there should be a solo ranked system where no one can team, not even duo. Be amazing, since no one will be boosted thus every one will be where they belong.
Yes, but it's not bad because of duos/trios/quads. It's more bad because of flamers and people who give up 5 minutes in.
There's nothing worst than being down in a game and your team not understanding what it would take to win and end game. Long games can be draining.
That's bad, but it's even worse when they don't even try.

That's the thing. I believe most players "try." I don't think they always fully understand the consequences of their actions.

For example, that low health enemy may look appealing, but the ally has limited vision, doesn't have a full item, low mana, and/or no flash.

Or: This enemy has killed me 3 times already. 2 of the times the ally almost killed them. The ally now hopes they can try again and finish on top. However, now the enemy has an item advantage or was ganked at an inopportune time.

This game has a lot of things for players to learn. Many of the tricks and tips players may not even be aware of. Such as when to push and freeze lanes, popping your health pots before a fight or engage as opposed to using them after when you near death, the importance of warding and best placements, when it's save to dive a tower with lower risk, jungle clear paths, initiating and following up a gank, focusing specific enemy champs, time management, when to Baron, etc.
I believe the comment is more aimed at the people that say "gg" at 5 minutes when someone gives up first blood which is extremely common nowadays.
It's better now that I've gone back to playing Teemo every game. Selling my soul to the devil helped as well.

I am solo only.

It's pretty bad in this elo (plat).

strictly solo player.
Yes it's hell, most of the games where I have a premade on my team or the enemy is a premade it's an insta loss 70% of the time regardless of how well I play.
The 30% of the time that I do win though tend to drag on forever due to the premade either refusing to group and take objectives or they engage alone with their friends without the rest of the team being there.

What's worse is that you can't even tell them to stop because then you'd get bombarded with insults and report threats or they ignore you for the rest of the game and refuse to help you with anything.


It's completely opposite though with a team of solos.
I win more than I lose, players actually listen to calls, and I rarely ever get toxic dickheads who talk shit.
DQ seems to bring out the worst in people and whenever I see a premade in my games I've began to dodge.

I'd rather lose 4LP and wait 5 minutes than waste 30+ minutes in a game with 3 assholes and lose 21LP

I completely agree. My experiences this season has been similar. It's frustrating to not have much control over games, regardless of how well you do. It's tough to take objectives solo when the enemy is trying to collapse on you. Since I mentioned that, it reminds me how towers were giving more defensive stats and were giving other boosts to prevent backdoors. This mostly increases game times for less organized and less skilled teams. 45+ mins games are so draining.

People often like to say that a solo player would be able to carry. I disliking hearing this because many good players can win their lane in under 15 mins, then have the game fall apart mid game when team play is crucial to securing objectives and  ending the game.

I will be adding you.

The majority of times that i've been the fifth on a four-person premade, it's been a pleasant experience.

Usually one of the four explains to me something like "Oh hey! Me and my buddy here are going to try (X). Do you mind if we (swap roles, don't ban this champ, etc)?".

It's quite nice actually. Maybe i'm just getting lucky.
Yeah, try refusing.  THEN see what happens.
You must be new... it's been like this for a while now.  Look up "Dynamic Queue" and you'll learn why.  It's only gonna get worse too.
I am not new. One issue is that Riot said there would be both Solo and Dynamic Queue, however that is not the case.
Riot lied.  They don't give half a shit about solo players.  Sorry man.

yes i am.  Majority of the games I lose are due to at least one of these reasons:
1. Someone on the enemy gets super fed and snowballs.
2. Enemy premade groups up while my team does not and we end up dying in these bad fights (3v5,1v3, etc). Basically, a coordinated team vs. an uncoordinated team. 
3. I have an afk.

You might think of these reasons as excuses but this is just my own experience. People should speak for their own experiences rather than joining on bandwagons.
And this is dramatically different from before in what way?

Well actually my post is incomplete. It is the mix of less vision on the map, more power shifted towards dragon stacks, snowballing being much easier, premades being larger than 2 resulting in better coordination between teams, and eloboosted players.

This season is much different from any other season specfically due to less tools and advantages being accessible for the SOLO player.  basically, there are more variables in the game out of my control and i am the type of player that plays meticulous and calculated.  i am willing to bet that if u take away the premades, alot of these players would play like headless chickens. ( no offense to anyone who premades)

The game became less and less enjoyable for me ever since Preseason, and DynamicQ was a nail in the coffin. I went from playing multiple games daily to usually playing one or two a day. Now that i found a new game i can put alot of time into i realized something...

League kinda blows now. Havent played since Tuesday and i have little to no desire to play it anytime soon.

I agree. I've found myself playing less games in a day. It's too frustrating.

I also appreciate you mentioning Overwatch. I wanted to bring it up. If you check out players opinions of the game, they feel that it has great characters, gameplay, and a mix of strategy and fun. I feel League of Legends has great champs, gameplay, strategy, and can be very intense and fun. However, I heard that much like League of Legends, Overwatch is less fun with unskilled players/teams and that playing with friends is necessary, even in it's early stages.

Individuality can be a gift and a curse. League also you to show individual skill, but team play and strategy requires much more effort than introverts may want to put forth.

This is the new "elo hell"
But yea, it's trash for me. FFS riot....... If I have to play against a damn 4-5 man again........
What they need is a hard reset at the start of next season, and then to split solo and duo+ mmr so it doesn't feel like your getting punished for playing solo. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

Yes. I don't even bother with it anymore, between the abomination called DQ, the clusterf*ck called balance and the constant introduction of more and more tedious elements. I've gotten completely fed up with the game. I heard Qtimes are getting even more attrocious than ever, this makes me happy in a spitefull way. Which itself is just sad.

People talk about games becoming stagnant if they don't change, but what is the point of change for the sake of change? How much has any major sport changed over the last decades? How popular do you think soccer would be if we all of a sudden changed the rules so that you now have to use ice-hockey clubs to play it? Me personally, I think people would abandon soccer and start watching icehockey, basketball, rugby or any other sport instead. 
Something that's close to perfected doesn't need much change, League has reached and left that stage long ago, sadly.
